frontmatter.title: Juno
frontmatter.subTitle: Mobile Application to log child's memories

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;  max-width: 1000px;

padding-bottom: 49.199999999999996%; position: relative; bottom: 0; left: 0; background-image: url('data:image/png;base64,'); background-size: cover; display: block;

children.value: Juno is a way to log your child’s uniqueness in an intelligent and beautiful app and print automatically designed memory books.
It was a personal project of a friend (Werner Hoier, CTO of Streetspotr) and his wife, who contracted me to develop it.
It is available at both Apple and Google Store.

node.excerpt: Juno Juno is a way to log your child’s uniqueness in an intelligent and beautiful app and print automatically designed memory books. About…
node.html:
Juno

Juno is a way to log your child’s uniqueness in an intelligent and beautiful app and print automatically designed memory books.

About

This was my first react-native "real-world-big-project".

It was a personal project of a friend (Werner Hoier, CTO of Streetspotr) and his wife, who contracted me to develop it.

It is available at both Apple and Google Store.

frontmatter.title: LocalExpert24
frontmatter.subTitle: LocalExpert24 is the expert network for civil engineering

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;  max-width: 1000px;

padding-bottom: 49.199999999999996%; position: relative; bottom: 0; left: 0; background-image: url('data:image/png;base64,'); background-size: cover; display: block;

children.value: LocalExpert24 is the expert network for civil engineering. It is a solution to secure and make photographs, videos and valuable additional information available in the long term - this way, specialist infrastructure knowledge becomes a real data treasure over the years.
In this project, I did both frontend, backend, and OPS.
The backend is hosted in Amazon EC2, the frontend in S3, and the database is an Aurora RDS.
Nowadays (May 2020), the project has +330 active users, +10k images and videos, and +500 documents.

node.excerpt: LocalExpert24 LocalExpert24 is the expert network for civil engineering. It is a solution to secure and make photographs, videos and…
node.html:
LocalExpert24

LocalExpert24 is the expert network for civil engineering. It is a solution to secure and make photographs, videos and valuable additional information available in the long term - this way, specialist infrastructure knowledge becomes a real data treasure over the years.

About

In this project, I did both frontend, backend, and OPS.

The backend is hosted in Amazon EC2, the frontend in S3, and the database is an Aurora RDS.

Nowadays (May 2020), the project has +330 active users, +10k images and videos, and +500 documents.

node.excerpt: Pocket Converter An open source React Native application published at Google Play Store and Apple App Store. About This was my first react…
node.html:
Pocket Converter

An open source React Native application published at Google Play Store and Apple App Store.

About

This was my first react-native released to both stores.

It was a personal project when I was learning react-native, so I decided to do it from beginning to end, releasing it to both Play Store and Apple Store.

It is open source and the code is hosted at GitHub.

frontmatter.title: POSPulse Dashboard
frontmatter.subTitle: POSpulse is the leading crowd-based shopper insights intelligence company in Europe

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;  max-width: 1000px;

padding-bottom: 49.199999999999996%; position: relative; bottom: 0; left: 0; background-image: url('data:image/png;base64,'); background-size: cover; display: block;

children.value: POSpulse is the leading crowd-based shopper insights intelligence company in Europe, providing leading industry segments with more transparency and excellence to better market their products and services. Over 800,000 shoppers and consumers generate insights along the entire customer decision journey, providing real-time feedback on the shopping experience.
This was my first project in a remote job, I had great experiences, and I could learn a lot about discipline and productivity.
I did maintenance to the old dashboard and admin panel of the company.

When POSPulse and StreetSpotr were merged, while the other team members were fixing issues in the old dashboard, I had the freedom to choose the stack, structure, and everything else to start the new dashboard.
Integrated POSPulse and StreetSpotr platforms on its acquisition
Coded a new dashboard from scratch to support both companies data
Improved platform UX with a new UI and performance improvements
Coded improvements in older POSPulse dashboard and admin panel

node.excerpt: POSpulse Dashboard POSpulse is the leading crowd-based shopper insights intelligence company in Europe, providing leading industry segments…
node.html:
POSpulse Dashboard

POSpulse is the leading crowd-based shopper insights intelligence company in Europe, providing leading industry segments with more transparency and excellence to better market their products and services. Over 800,000 shoppers and consumers generate insights along the entire customer decision journey, providing real-time feedback on the shopping experience.

About

This was my first project in a remote job, I had great experiences, and I could learn a lot about discipline and productivity.

I did maintenance to the old dashboard and admin panel of the company.

When POSPulse and StreetSpotr were merged, while the other team members were fixing issues in the old dashboard, I had the freedom to choose the stack, structure, and everything else to start the new dashboard.

Highlights

  • Integrated POSPulse and StreetSpotr platforms on its acquisition
  • Coded a new dashboard from scratch to support both companies data
  • Improved platform UX with a new UI and performance improvements
  • Coded improvements in older POSPulse dashboard and admin panel

frontmatter.title: Zulu Desktop
frontmatter.subTitle: Zulu UC is desktop and mobile integration for businesses using PBXact and FreePBX phone systems

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;  max-width: 1000px;

padding-bottom: 49.199999999999996%; position: relative; bottom: 0; left: 0; background-image: url('data:image/png;base64,'); background-size: cover; display: block;

children.value: Sangoma Technologies is a leading voice and Unified Communications (UC) solution provider, award-winning cloud and on-premise UC PBX solutions. Also the primary developer and sponsor of the Asterisk project, the world’s most widely used open-source communications software, and FreePBX, the world’s most widely used open-source PBX software.
Working in a global team as a frontend developer, I help to maintain the Zulu Desktop project implementing features, fixing bugs, and refactoring legacy code.
It is a client made with React for web and Electron for desktop.
We use ES6, redux, redux-thunk, jest, and shallow for development.
We use Asterisk, Socket.IO, and FreePBX for communication.
Coded application improvements in an agile environment with one-week sprints
Developed a solution for text formatting support similar to Slack
Refactored the Dialpad container logic (the heart of the application)

node.excerpt: Zulu Desktop Sangoma Technologies is a leading voice and Unified Communications (UC) solution provider, award-winning cloud and on-premise…
node.html:
Zulu Desktop

Sangoma Technologies is a leading voice and Unified Communications (UC) solution provider, award-winning cloud and on-premise UC PBX solutions. Also the primary developer and sponsor of the Asterisk project, the world’s most widely used open-source communications software, and FreePBX, the world’s most widely used open-source PBX software.

About

Working in a global team as a frontend developer, I help to maintain the Zulu Desktop project implementing features, fixing bugs, and refactoring legacy code.

It is a client made with React for web and Electron for desktop.

We use ES6, redux, redux-thunk, jest, and shallow for development.

We use Asterisk, Socket.IO, and FreePBX for communication.

Highlights

  • Coded application improvements in an agile environment with one-week sprints
  • Developed a solution for text formatting support similar to Slack
  • Refactored the Dialpad container logic (the heart of the application)
  • Implemented transfer call functionality

frontmatter.title: Work Around the World
frontmatter.subTitle: Price and weather match for relocating

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;  max-width: 1000px;

padding-bottom: 49.199999999999996%; position: relative; bottom: 0; left: 0; background-image: url('data:image/png;base64,'); background-size: cover; display: block;

children.value: A way to check if you match with ticket prices and weather of places you are willing to relocate.
This project was made as a step for a technical interview I had with a company.
I like it and would like to add it here because it shows a bit of my skills with React.JS, Context API, and tests with Enzyme.
As the objective was to delivery it ASAP, I used TailwindCSS to delivery some beautiful in few time, so I hadn't to care so much about CSS.
It is open source and the code is hosted at

node.excerpt: Work Around the World A way to check if you match with ticket prices and weather of places you are willing to relocate. About This project…
node.html:
Work Around the World

A way to check if you match with ticket prices and weather of places you are willing to relocate.

About

This project was made as a step for a technical interview I had with a company.

I like it and would like to add it here because it shows a bit of my skills with React.JS, Context API, and tests with Enzyme.

As the objective was to delivery it ASAP, I used TailwindCSS to delivery some beautiful in few time, so I hadn't to care so much about CSS.

It is open source and the code is hosted at GitHub.
